title: Commercial automated scRNA-seq workflow

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description: Important! This step must be performed in a designated RNAse free and pre-cDNA amplification area, keeping reagents chilled at all times

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
Prepare the cell lysis buffer, which will provide sufficient volume for one 96-well plate
AB
1ReagentVolume (µl)
2NEBNext Cell Lysis Buffer (10x)24
3Murine RNase Inhibitor12

5Total240
Mix well by pipetting.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
Use the Formulatrix Mantis microfluidic liquid handler to dispense
of lysis buffer into a 96-well PCR plate.

source.body: If required add a diluted stock (1/500,000) of ERCCs into the lysis buffer.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
Seal dispensed plates, centrifuge immediately
and keep chilled on ice.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
PAUSE POINT Lysis buffer plates can be stored at
prior to cell sorting. Plates can be stored for < 6 months.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
Defrost lysis buffer plates prior to cell sorting, centrifuge
and keep chilled on ice.

source.body: When FACS sorting, take care of plate calibration/priming prior to single-cell deposition. If many plates are deposited in parallel, repeat the calibration/priming at least every 8 plates.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
After FACS sorting, seal and centrifuge plates immediately
and keep chilled on ice.

source.title: Preparation of lysis buffer plates and FACS

source.description:
PAUSE POINT Plates of sorted cells can be stored at
for < 6 months. the quality of the data depends on the cell type and duration of storage.

Carefully remove and discard the supernatant without disturbing the bead pellet.

Transfer supernatant into a new 96-well PCR plate, taking care not to disturb the pellet.

source.body:
Purified amplified cDNA is quantified with a fluorescence based assay. We use the AccuClear Ultra High Sensitivity dsDNA Quantitation kit with 7 DNA standards (Biotium) according to manufacturer's instructions.
To streamline the workflow, we do not normalise sample input for library preparation. Instead, we calculate an average concentration and transfer a fixed volume such that 5-25 ng of each successfully amplified cDNA sample enters library preparation.

source.name: AccuClear® Ultra High Sensitivity dsDNA Quantitation Kit with DNA Standards

source.description:
Pipette
of each DNA standard into wells A1 - G1 of a 96-well PCR plate. Add nuclease-free water to H1.

Dilute the AccuClear dye (100X) to working concentration by mixing
dye with
AccuClear buffer in a 50 ml Falcon. Mix thoroughly by vortexing and transfer to a 384-well reservoir.

Use the SPT Labtech Mosquito LV to stamp
of amplified cDNA and
of known standards in triplicate into a 384-well assay plate. Immediately proceed to the next step.

Use the Agilent Bravo with a 384ST multichannel head to add
1 X AccuClear dye from the reservoir to the assay plate, mix thoroughly by pipetting.
Measure fluorescence values on a BMG FLUOstar Omega plate reader calibrated for use with AccuClear dye.
Confirm known standards are performing as expected.
Dilute any samples >125 ng/µl with nuclease free water so they are in the range of 10 - 125 ng/µl and repeat quantitation.

source.body: We use 5X the volume of standard vs sample in our assay setup, which should allow a quantitative range of 0.15 ng/µl - 125 ng/µl. This deviates from the standard kit SOP which has a stated range of 0.03 ng/µl - 25 ng/µl.

source.description: Taking an average across the plate. Transfer ~ 10 ng of cDNA into a new 96-well PCR plate for sequencing library preparation.

PAUSE POINT Purified amplified cDNA can be stored at
for several weeks prior to library preparation.

source.body: We use the NEBNext® Single Cell/Low Input RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina for library preparation, which we have automated on the Agilent Bravo NGS platform with some modifications. We use a custom adapter set, however any TruSeq adapters are suitable.

source.name: NEBNext Single Cell/Low Input RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina - 96 rxns

source.description: Allow AMPure XP beads to equilibrate to room temperature (~30 minutes). Ensure solution is homogenous prior to use, mixing gently by inversion.

for the beads to settle.

Transfer
into a new 96-well PCR plate, taking care not to disturb the pellet.

source.body: We use alternative TruSeq compatible adapters, which do not require the USER enzyme incubation step. If using NEBNext adapters, follow the steps in the NEB protocol to add USER enzyme to the ligation reaction.

source.body:
We use KAPA HiFi HotStart ReadyMix and unique dual indexed (UDI) tag plates for library PCR.
Note: this deviates from the standard NEB protocol which uses NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix and different cycling conditions.

3Total3000

3Total3000

PCR mix and
sample into a lyophilised plate of UDIs and mix thoroughly by pipetting. The final concentration of each UDI in the PCR reaction is 2 µM.

source.title: Pooling and purification of amplified libraries

source.description:
In a post-PCR lab, use the Hamilton STAR or Beckman NX-8 to combine
of each sample per plate to form an equivolume pool of 96 samples.

source.title: Quality control and normilisation of sequencing libraries

source.body: Library sequencing pools are quantified on an Agilent Bioanalyzer. Pools are then diluted to 2.8 nM for sequencing.

source.title: Quality control and normilisation of sequencing libraries

source.description:
Run
of the library pool in triplicate on a Bioanalyzer using the DNA 1000 kit.

source.title: Quality control and normilisation of sequencing libraries

source.description: Taking an average of the readings add nuclease-free water to the library pool to produce a final concentration of 2.8 nM.

source.body: We sequence samples on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 instrument (paired-end, 75-bp reads) according to the manufacturer's protocol. We typically aim for an average depth of 1 million reads per cell, plexing up to 384 samples per run.

materials.name: NEBNext Single Cell/Low Input RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina - 96 rxns
AccuClear® Ultra High Sensitivity dsDNA Quantitation Kit with DNA Standards

description: This SOP describes the procedure for plate based scRNA-seq performed with a commercial available kit from New England BioLabs. Following library construction, samples are pooled in equivolume and quantified, prior to sequencing on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 platform.
